item.title: angie add a quote by Marya Hornbacher
item.description: "We turn skeletons into goddesses and look to them as if they might teach us how not to need." -- Marya Hornbacher

item.title: angie add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "I certainly believe we all suffer damage, one way or another. How could we not,except in a world of perfect parents, siblings, neighbours, companions? And then there is the question on which so much depends, of how we react to the damage: whether we admit it or repress it,and how this affects our dealings with others.Some admit the damage, and try to mitigate it;some spend their lives trying to help others who are damaged; and there are those whose main concern is to avoid further damage to themselves, at whatever cost. And those are the ones who are ruthless, and the ones to be careful of." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: angie add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: angie add a quote by Chely Wright
item.description: "I hear the word "tolerance" -- that some people are trying to teach people to be tolerant of gays. I'm not satisfied with that word. I am gay, and I am not seeking to be "tolerated." One tolerates a toothache, rush-hour traffic, an annoying neighbor with a cluttered yard. I am not a negative to be tolerated." -- Chely Wright

item.title: angie add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: angie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I wanted so badly to lie down next to her on the couch, to wrap my arms around her and sleep. Not fuck, like in those movies. Not even have sex. Just sleep together in the most innocent sense of the phrase. But I lacked the courage and she had a boyfriend and I was gawky and she was gorgeous and I was hopelessly boring and she was endlessly fascinating. So I walked back to my room and collapsed on the bottom bunk, thinking that if people were rain, I was drizzle and she was hurricane." -- John Green

item.title: angie add a quote by Stefan Zweig
item.description: "Time to leave now, get out of this room, go somewhere, anywhere; sharpen this feeling of happiness and freedom, stretch your limbs, fill your eyes, be awake, wider awake, vividly awake in every sense and every pore." -- Stefan Zweig

item.title: angie add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Two possibilities exist: either we are alone in the Universe or we are not. Both are equally terrifying." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: angie add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: angie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "You can't deny laughter; when it comes, it plops down in your favorite chair and stays as long as it wants." -- Stephen King

item.title: angie add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: angie add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: angie add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: angie add a quote by Bohumil Hrabal
item.description: "I pop a beautiful sentence into my mouth and suck it like a fruit drop." -- Bohumil Hrabal

item.title: angie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If there is love, smallpox scars are as pretty as dimples. I'll love your face no matter what it looks like. Because it's yours." -- Stephen King

item.title: angie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When all else fails, give up and go to the library." -- Stephen King

item.title: angie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Some people have lives; some people have music." -- John Green

item.title: angie add a quote by Ludwig van Beethoven
item.description: "Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy" -- Ludwig van Beethoven

item.title: angie add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Family not only need to consist of merely those whom we share blood, but also for those whom we'd give blood." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: angie add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: angie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: angie add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "I believe in pink. I believe that laughing is the best calorie burner. I believe in kissing, kissing a lot. I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day and I believe in miracles." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: angie add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: angie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: angie add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing." -- Socrates

item.title: angie add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "I love people who make me laugh. I honestly think it's the thing I like most, to laugh. It cures a multitude of ills. It's probably the most important thing in a person." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: angie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: angie add a quote by Rick Bragg
item.description: "Every life deserves a certain amount of dignity, no matter how poor or damaged the shell that carries it." -- Rick Bragg

item.title: angie add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book… or you take a trip… and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: angie add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "She liked books more than anything else, and was, in fact, always inventing stories of beautiful things and telling them to herself." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett
